stories.text:
It's clear that the level of sophistication in recruitment, screening, and hiring in the tech world has reached new heights in the past decade. This has left me, and I assume many of us with a lot of absurd hurdles to jump to ever have a chance. It is, for me, a total black-box: I fail again and again, without any feedback of how to change. All I can do is try something slightly different the next time, with a new application/company, and see if I can tell anything from the changed variables.

While the problems with tech bootcamps need not be restated here, as an observer from the outside, I am always attracted to, specifically, the components of them that deal with actually forming a resume, getting recruiters, doing interviews, creating a portfolio, etc.

Is there a service that exists which can train people to apply to jobs? I just want someone human I can talk to, that knows the business, and can give me feedback on a given application, help me understand what I am missing.
stories.title: Ask HN: Resources/services for just the hiring process
